job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer, with passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video.

   Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!

        You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems. You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will have experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release.

       You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, our R&D research is guided by our co-founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.

   If you know and love Voicebox, Whisper, VALL-E, SPEAR-TTS and more - and you love machine learning and large data, then we would love to talk to you. We will also want to talk to you - if that's what you dream of doing.  

What will you be doing?

     In this position, you'll join the team to help develop our LLM-based TTS system that will provide our customers with voice clones that are indistinguishable from real voices. You will also help us create high quality, production ready code and take ownership of production pipelines. This would include:
     * Creating new or refining existing data processing pipelines that will run on very large amounts of data.
     * Taking hypotheses, ideas or papers and creating implementations of solutions on the back of these.
     * Running experiments on the back of the created implementations to evaluate and verify your hypotheses.
     * Work on model training and inference optimisation.
     * Contributing to a high-quality codebase, developing tests where necessary, and participating in code reviews.
     * Helping a team of Research engineers and Scientists to write clean and efficient code, and define best practices.
     * Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
     * Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
     * Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in London
job_details.full_text:
Machine Learning Engineer - Large Models

We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer, with passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video.

   Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!

        You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems. You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will have experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release.

       You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, our R&D research is guided by our co-founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.

   If you know and love Voicebox, Whisper, VALL-E, SPEAR-TTS and more - and you love machine learning and large data, then we would love to talk to you. We will also want to talk to you - if that's what you dream of doing.  

What will you be doing?

     In this position, you'll join the team to help develop our LLM-based TTS system that will provide our customers with voice clones that are indistinguishable from real voices. You will also help us create high quality, production ready code and take ownership of production pipelines. This would include:
     * Creating new or refining existing data processing pipelines that will run on very large amounts of data.
     * Taking hypotheses, ideas or papers and creating implementations of solutions on the back of these.
     * Running experiments on the back of the created implementations to evaluate and verify your hypotheses.
     * Work on model training and inference optimisation.
     * Contributing to a high-quality codebase, developing tests where necessary, and participating in code reviews.
     * Helping a team of Research engineers and Scientists to write clean and efficient code, and define best practices.
     * Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
     * Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
     * Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in London

profile_classification.rationale: The role focuses on developing LLM-based TTS systems and creating realistic synthetic humans through text-to-video, directly aligning with generative AI applications. The emphasis on fine-tuning, productionizing prototypes, and building user-facing systems, alongside specific mentions of generative models and frameworks, strongly points to a GenAI Engineer profile.

phrases.phrase: Creating new or refining existing data processing pipelines that will run on very large amounts of data.
phrases.justification: This phrase directly describes the process of building and maintaining data pipelines, which is a core component of Data Engineering.

phrases.phrase: help develop our LLM-based TTS system
phrases.justification: This explicitly mentions working with Large Language Models (LLMs) for Text-to-Speech (TTS) systems, which falls under generative modeling.

phrases.phrase: create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video.
phrases.justification: This describes the creation of synthetic media using generative models, a key area for GenAI.

phrases.phrase: Taking hypotheses, ideas or papers and creating implementations of solutions on the back of these.
phrases.justification: This involves translating research or ideas into functional model implementations.

phrases.phrase: Running experiments on the back of the created implementations to evaluate and verify your hypotheses.
phrases.justification: This describes the process of model evaluation and validation.

phrases.phrase: Work on model training and inference optimisation.
phrases.justification: This directly relates to the core activities of training and optimizing machine learning models.

phrases.phrase: If you know and love Voicebox, Whisper, VALL-E, SPEAR-TTS and more
phrases.justification: These are all well-known models and technologies in the generative AI and speech synthesis space.

phrases.phrase: someone who loves to code and build working systems.
phrases.justification: This indicates a focus on practical implementation and building functional software.

phrases.phrase: experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release.
phrases.justification: This covers the end-to-end process of software creation.

phrases.phrase: contributing to a high-quality codebase, developing tests where necessary, and participating in code reviews.
phrases.justification: These are standard software development practices focused on code quality and maintainability.

phrases.phrase: write clean and efficient code, and define best practices.
phrases.justification: This emphasizes the development of robust and well-structured code.

phrases.phrase: Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
phrases.justification: This highlights the creation of production-ready software that directly reaches users or products.

phrases.phrase: Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions.
phrases.justification: This involves taking experimental models and making them into deployable, functional software.
This indicates responsibility for managing and maintaining pipelines that are in production.

phrases.phrase: Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
phrases.justification: This describes managing the entire lifecycle of an ML model, including its deployment and maintenance in production.
